action.content:
You are playing a text adventure game. I will describe what you can perceive in the game. You write the single action you want to take in the game starting with >. Only reply with an action.
For example:
> open cupboard

You can have up to two objects in your inventory at the same time.

Your goal for this game is: Put the banana in the freezer, the book on the side table and the plate on the table.

Once you have achieved your goal, write "> done" to end the game.

You are in a broom closet now. There are a mop and a broom. The mop is on the floor. The broom is on the floor. There is a passage to a hallway here.
action.label: context

action.content: > pick up the broom
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 0
You take the broom. In your inventory you have a broom.
action.label: context

action.content: > go through the passage to the hallway
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 1
I don't know what you mean.
action.label: context

action.content: > go to the hallway
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 2
You are in a hallway now. There is a potted plant. The potted plant is on the floor. There are passages to a broom closet and a kitchen here.
action.label: context

action.content: > pick up the potted plant
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 3
You take the potted plant. In your inventory you have a broom and a potted plant.
action.label: context

action.content: > go to the kitchen
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 4
You are in a kitchen now. There are a refrigerator, a counter and a cupboard. The refrigerator is closed. The cupboard is closed. There are passages to a hallway, a pantry and a living room here.
action.label: context

action.content: > open the cupboard
action.label: response

action.content: Round: 5
The cupboard is now open. In the cupboard there is a plate.
action.label: context

action.label: response
